Package game

Interface IAction

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActionChat, ActionDrop, ActionExits, ActionGo, ActionHelp, ActionInventory, ActionInvestigate, ActionLookAround, ActionMurderer, ActionNote, ActionPick, ActionReadNotes, ActionTerminate, ActionUnlock
    public interface IAction
    The interface defines methods necessary for implementation of game command. For each command that can be used in the game, there is a class that handles its processing. The class must implement the methods defined by this interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      Method returns the name of the game command.
      java.lang.String process​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Method for processing the game command.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Method returns the name of the game command. It is a single word that the player uses to identify the game command on the console, e.g. 'help', 'end', 'go' etc.
        Returns:
        the name

      • process

        java.lang.String process​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Method for processing the game command. The number of parameters (expected elements in the array) depends on the specific command, e.g. commands 'help' and 'end' have no parameters, the command for moving between locations will probably have one parameter (target location), commands for trading, using or combining items may have more parameters.

        The method must check the parameters (number, correctness), make changes to the game state and then return the text that will be printed to the console.

        Parameters:
        args - the args
        Returns:
        the string
